channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Roundabout sign has rotated, 14th July
item.description:
The roundabout sign is attached to a lamp post and should be aligned with the light but has been hit by passing traffic and is now not facing oncoming traffic. People already ignore that there is a roundabout so this won't help. The lamp post is so close to the road that the sign is overhanging when in its intended position. It has been hit a few times now and although moved back by my taller neighbour, it has been knocked again and faces the houses opposite.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees overhanging the road and effecting telephone lines, 14th July
item.description:
By Hartley Lane junction and on the Leckhampton Hill road. Opposite Shadowlands and The Lodge the land is owned by an individual and we can't get hold of her. The e mail we have is joreeves1@hotmail.co.uk Because it is private land BT won't do it and the council say it;s not their problem . But if the tress come down they will block Leckhampton Hill and cause traffic chaos

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing. 30 MPH sign, 14th July
item.description:
On entering the B4063 Cheltenham Road East Missing 30 MPH sign does not make the TRO Legal. ? Therefore excess speed is commonplace With the much used cycleway in close proximity

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
